Module com.example.miniproyecto4
Package com.example.miniproyecto4.model.Player

Class ComputerPlayer

java.lang.Object
com.example.miniproyecto4.model.Player.Player
com.example.miniproyecto4.model.Player.ComputerPlayer
All Implemented Interfaces:
IPlayer, Serializable
public class ComputerPlayer extends Player
Represents a computer-controlled player in the Battleship game. Extends the basic Player functionality with automated shot selection and tracking of available shot locations.
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • ComputerPlayer

      public ComputerPlayer()
      Constructs a ComputerPlayer with default settings. Initializes the player with the nickname "Computer" and a new board, and sets up the list of available shots.

    • ComputerPlayer

      public ComputerPlayer(IBoard board)
      Constructs a ComputerPlayer with a specified board. Initializes the player with the nickname "Computer" and the provided board, and sets up the list of available shots.
      Parameters:
      board - the game board to use for this player

  • Method Details

    • getNextShot

      public Coordinate getNextShot()
      Selects and returns the next shot coordinate for the computer player. Randomly selects a coordinate from the available shots list and removes it.
      Returns:
      the next coordinate to shoot at, or null if no shots are available

    • markShotTaken

      public void markShotTaken(Coordinate coordinate)
      Marks a specific coordinate as taken, removing it from available shots. Used to update the available shots list when a shot is taken by the AI strategy.
      Parameters:
      coordinate - the coordinate to mark as taken

    • getAvailableShotsCount

      public int getAvailableShotsCount()
      Returns the number of shots still available to the computer player.
      Returns:
      the count of available shot coordinates

    • isShotAvailable

      public boolean isShotAvailable(Coordinate coordinate)
      Checks if a specific coordinate is still available for shooting.
      Parameters:
      coordinate - the coordinate to check
      Returns:
      true if the coordinate is available, false otherwise

    • reset

      public void reset()
      Resets the computer player to its initial state. Calls the parent reset method and reinitializes the available shots list and random number generator.
      Specified by:
      reset in interface IPlayer
      Overrides:
      reset in class Player
